example.text: [[user]] are ready to deliver real immigration reform and invest in a secure border. House Republicans are once again recycling failed extreme policies that do not work. Team Normal vs. Team Extreme. [[url]]

This bipartisan bill will close the gaps in our immigration system for our brave veterans who have served our nation and eliminate any fear of deportation. Additionally, we passed the bipartisan National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2023, which strengthens our national security by increasing pay for service members, making major investments in diversity and inclusion, funding the development of new technologies and deepening our global network of allies.

Additionally, this year's defense bill provides historic funding for research a Historically Black Colleges and Universities, allocates $800 million to provide security and assistance to the Ukraine Armed Forces and raises pay for our service members by 4.6 percent. In other news, I had the honor of being elected Chair of the House Democratic Caucus by my colleagues.

Mr. Speaker, I rise today in strong opposition to the resolution. It is shameful that the temporary Republican majority continue to waste the American people's time with baseless accusations and rightwing conspiracy theories.

I look forward to continuing to represent the Inland Empire in my new leadership role and ensuring our region has a bigger seat at the table when it comes to securing much-needed resources to help our community. I remain committed to a legislative agenda that lowers costs for Americans, protects abortion rights, strengthens our Democracy and tackles gun violence.

This bipartisan bill will close the gaps in our immigration system for our brave veterans who have served our nation and eliminate any fear of deportation. Additionally, we passed the bipartisan National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2023, which strengthens our national security by increasing pay for service members, making major investments in diversity and inclusion, funding the development of new technologies and deepening our global network of allies.

Additionally, this year's defense bill provides historic funding for research a Historically Black Colleges and Universities, allocates $800 million to provide security and assistance to the Ukraine Armed Forces and raises pay for our service members by 4.6 percent. In other news, I had the honor of being elected Chair of the House Democratic Caucus by my colleagues.
